ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The skills necessary for independent laboratory research, scientific writing, presenting your findings.
I got a lot of experience in the wet lab
I had the opportunity to perform research as well as write grants and present my research in front of my peers.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Providing greater guidelines/expectations to be communicated with students. Providing mentorship opportunities for students unfamiliar with research papers/etc...

I appreciate this course giving 2 credits this semester so that I can allocate more time to research without having to fill up my schedule to meet the required course load. However, seeing as this is the intensive track for the MCDB senior thesis, I wish there could also be ways to meet as a cohort before the final oral presentation for workshops, discussions on each other's projects, etc.
Better communication farther in advance about how we are evaluated (i.e. rubrics for assignments available farther in advance).
It's really great to get the chance to do your own project. Also, this will definitely show you whether you really like research or not.
It would have been nice if there was more programming associated with this course such as workshops on research techniques.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're already working many hours in a biology-related lab, I would do the senior intensive track. You're doing the work anyway, but now you get a special tag on your degree and you don't have to take as many courses your senior year.
Yes! It's a great way to develop research skills. Also, the intensive program is really the only one where you're going to get actual work done in the lab. 10 hours a week is just not enough.
Yes! If youre interested in research, this course will give you credit for 20 hours of research
